modName: Dawnguard - Castle Volkihar without dirty things
summary:
DAWNGUARD
This mod simply removes a lot of 'dirty things' found in Castle Volkihar: blood, bones, 'strange food'...
It also alters some of the DLC items: bloody goblets, jugs, tankards.
descriptionHtml:
Name: Dawnguard - Castle Volkihar without dirty things
Version: 1.0
Date: 2013/09/18
Category: Miscellaneous
Requirement: Dawnguard DLC ([url=http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Skyrim:Dawnguard]http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Skyrim:Dawnguard[/url])
Author: BG3
Source: [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/42496/]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/42496/[/url]



[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/0qmGshv.png[/img][/center]


[img]http://i.imgur.com/xcTOeYo.png[/img]
This mod simply removes a lot of "dirty things" found in Castle Volkihar: blood, bones, "strange food"...
It also alters some of the DLC items: bloody goblets, jugs, tankards.


[img]http://i.imgur.com/RXbu4iK.png[/img]
There is absolutely no script in this mod: so you should only use it [b][u]after you have finished the main questline[/u][/b] (in order to not break the dark vampire atmosphere).
Two cells are edited: Volkihar Keep and Volkihar Cathedral.
The following items are modified to remove blood:
[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/wn5jZxx.png[/img][/center]Each time these items added by the DLC are used, they will always display non bloody textures, inside and also outside the castle.
[right][img]http://i.imgur.com/vxi2mEm.png[/img][/right]

[img]http://i.imgur.com/vjyLVDC.png[/img]
You can use [b][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/modmanager/]Nexus Mod Manager[/url][/b].

- = or = -
--------------
Manual Install
--------------
1. Extract the files you choose to add in the (install folder)\Skyrim\Data folder
2. Start Skyrim Launcher, click "Data Files", place a checkmark beside dgCVwdt.esp file
--------------


[img]http://i.imgur.com/4AxKRor.png[/img]
You can use [b][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/modmanager/]Nexus Mod Manager[/url][/b].

- = or = -
----------------
Manual Uninstall
----------------
1. Start Skyrim Launcher, click Data Files, uncheck dgCVwdt.esp
2. Delete the file (install folder)\Skyrim\Data\dgCVwdt.esp
----------------


[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/8Oh6wpul.jpg[/img][/center]


[img]http://i.imgur.com/ZfJPnI8.png[/img]
Maybe some incompatibilities can appear with mods altering Castle Volkihar.
Some items, parts may not disappear immediately. Against that, you can try to force Volkihar Castle respawn by leaving its cells: [url=http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Skyrim:Castle_Volkihar]10 days[/url] (it could be a good idea). More radical, you can use the [url=http://www.uesp.net/wiki/Skyrim:Console]console[/url] (open it, select the element, type "disable" and press enter).


[img]http://i.imgur.com/XSpSoDt.png[/img]
1.0, 2013/04/01 - Initial release.


[img]http://i.imgur.com/Jliw306.png[/img]
You can find me on TESNexus as 'BG3'.


[img]http://i.imgur.com/UPyg8Oq.png[/img]
Thanks to Bethesda for Skyrim
Thanks to TESNexus for the a one-stop-shop resource for authors and players
Thanks to LHammonds for the Readme Generator this file was based on
Thanks to Robert E. Leuschke... for Great Vibes Regular, which is the name of the open font used for the titles - [url=http://openfontlibrary.org/en/font/rebecca]http://openfontlibrary.org/en/font/rebecca[/url]


[img]http://i.imgur.com/wUZf736.png[/img]
7-Zip - [url=http://sourceforge.net/projects/sevenzip/]http://sourceforge.net/projects/sevenzip/[/url]
Fallout Mod Manager (BSA explorer) - [url=http://newvegas.nexusmods.com/mods/36901]http://newvegas.nexusmods.com/mods/36901[/url]
Creation Kit - [url=http://www.creationkit.com/]http://www.creationkit.com/[/url]
TES5Edit - [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/25859]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/25859[/url]
Readme Generator - [url=http://HammondsLegacy.com/obmm/tools_readme_generator1.asp]http://HammondsLegacy.com/obmm/tools_readme_generator1.asp[/url]


[img]http://i.imgur.com/1gzIRcA.png[/img]
Please let only this mod available in this [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/42496/]Nexusmods webpage[/url].


[img]http://i.imgur.com/LXJHjDe.png[/img]
[b][u]Highly[/u] recommended[/b] : Static Mesh Improvement Mod by [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/users/283020]Brumbek[/url] (shown in the screenshots) - [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/8655]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/8655[/url]


[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/GdOc9wNl.jpg[/img][/center]
